creatures

Class CreatureFigure

  • java.lang.Object
    • creatures.CreatureFigure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TimerListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CircleCreatureFigure, SquareCreatureFigure, TriangleCreatureFigure

    public abstract class CreatureFigure
extends java.lang.Object
implements TimerListener
    The abstract class CreatureFigure holds the very basics of what a creature is. It is only when the CreatureFigure class is extended when certain characteristics are set.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alexander Beliaev

    • Constructor Detail

      • CreatureFigure

        public CreatureFigure(int hue,
                      double scale,
                      Position position,
                      CreatureFigure.Orientation orientation,
                      GameLevel level,
                      double speed)
        Creates a new creature with the specified characteristics.
        Parameters:
        hue - the hue of the creature.
        scale - the scale of the creature.
        position - the initial position of the creature.
        orientation - the orientation of the creature.
        level - the level.
        speed - the speed of the creature.

      • isCollision

        public abstract boolean isCollision(Position position)
        Performs a check if a certain position is within the body of the creature.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the given position is on or within the body of the creature.

      • getShape

        public abstract Figures getShape()
        Returns a Figures value describing the shape of the creature.
        Returns:
        a Figures value describing the shape of the creature.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the creature by iterating over any data structures holding any previously defined actions; as well as incrementing the amount of steps it should be taking. The amount of steps taken is directly dependent upon the scaling factor of the creature. The creature may therefore not precisely one position each update, but rather parts of or several whole.

      • setDamageTaken

        public void setDamageTaken(int damage)
        Reduces the current life of the creature by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        damage - the damage to inflict upon the creature.

      • enableTeleport

        public void enableTeleport(java.lang.Long time)
        A default method to enable a creature to be able to create TeleportTiles.

        The time given to the method is the amount of time before the first teleport is supposed to be set.
        Parameters:
        time - the time to be elapsed before setting the first teleport.

                                  Action action)
        Adds an action which will be performed after a certain time following the spawning of the creature.
        Parameters:

        action - the action to be added.
